Hm? This is for a game I want to make, not an actual game

Oh. The wording is very confusing. What is the game supposed to be about?

It's - don't run away - sorta like World of Warcraft. But I got rid of all the stupid stuff, and made it fun and less violent. Instead of PvP, and all these fantasy creatures, I made it humans only and way more realistic. It's also based around having a great multiplayer experience. You can play with your friends the entire game, if you wish. Also, as you can probably see, this is an island. You sail the seas traveling to different islands. This is only the first. As you level up, you get better boats. At level 34 you get a sail boat, which can only travel small distances. At level 65, you get a small boat, which can travel from island to island. Hope this helps
It seems like something that if you replicate in minecraft it would be awesome. Do you know how big it should be (as in the area?)

The whole world map area is 12.24 feet, so let's put that into, say, 1224 miles. Each block in minecraft is 3 yards, 1 mile = 1760 yards, so 1760 x 1224.

That's an area of 2,154,240 blocks in Minecraft...a little too many to get done in reasonable time. If you really want to do it, maybe on a smaller scale, I'll do it with ya.

But it still wouldn't be possible probably, because so many mechanics are needed that aren't in Minecraft, such as sailing, unless mods are used. Really, the game could be made on it's own, but I just can't model, code, texture, and I absolutely don't have the money.

I found a troll saying he wanted to make a similar game, and people were saying he can't do it. One guy told him he needed to learn C++ or C#, and he said "Thanks, but I don't want to make a text game. I want to make a game with graphics :)" What an ignorant fool.

------------------------------How we build the map------------------------------

We will make the Mistral Island multiple times, until we get the size we want (Probably around 30,000 blocks in length). After that, if I understand what ROFL is going to do, he will write a program to make the entire island (without details) for us, but it will be flat. Then I go in and use WorldPainter to add elevation. Next we probably use something to make different tree types. Then we all go in and add cities and villages and all the little things we need. Finally, we add the quest system.
